adrFormatAddress: 46 W 73rd St, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text: I’ve been taking my dog to camp canine since he was 5 months old. It was a fantastic socialization experience when he was a puppy and he grew to absolutely love it! It’s been 2.5 years now and he still goes and knows “camp canine” by name. The staff here are so friendly and recognize and greet my dog by name every time he comes! Amanda is the absolute best and treats my dog like an absolute king - will even personally send me photos when he’s there - my dog adores her! The owner Mike is so responsive and truly cares for all of the dogs. Brenda is so caring and sweet with my pup and all of his friends! Lena and Aria are always very responsive and friendly when I call or am dropping off and Lynn goes out of her way to find a spot for my pup when he needs a bath or grooming. Speaking of grooming, I cannot recommend Kathy enough for doodles - she just nails it!  I am so grateful to have Camp Canine in the neighborhood and always know my dog is getting the most attention and love when he’s there. Highly recommend!

originalText.text:
I have been taking my dog to Camp Canine for over three years. I have used all the services - boarding, daycare and grooming. I have seen mass improvements on efficiency and member communication since Mike has taken ownership (almost 2 years ago).

Why do I love camp canine?
The staff is super friendly and very accommodating. They are incredibly responsive as well. Here's two examples:

1. Cooper (my dog) had been having some major stomach problems and I kept him out of camp for over two weeks. He had been put on meds and received an IV. Upon his return to Camp, I asked the staff if he was acting himself or any issues - the replied immediately and gave me updates a few times that week.

2. Cooper was feeling sick once at daycare - he threw up. They called me to tell me his condition and that they put him in the front office, holding him and giving him some pumpkin and rice mix to help ease his stomach. WHO DOES THAT?!

I could find another daycare closer to my home and cheaper. But it's worth the time and money to have amazing care for my fur child.

Also...I have yet to find another daycare that has such amazing hours.

originalText.text:
Camp Canine - How wonderful can a business be?  Let me tell u.  Although I've never been to any other dog hotel/dog care, I don't ever want to go to any other.  Everyone who works there is AMAZING, ORGANIZED, FRIENDLY, RESPONSIVE, EDUCATIONAL, & MOST OF ALL, THEY TREAT MY OR YOUR DOG LIKE ITS THEIR OWN!  It's my 3rd overnite trip & my dog ALLIE LOVES IT THERE!.  They have EVERYTHING you can do to occupy ALLIE in overnight or daycare.  It was recordbreak heat the other day & they take Allie's collapsible bowl & H2O bottle to the park w/her.  She had VIP sleeping/boarding because she likes to sleep in diff. places, & most of all, the TUCKIN STORYTELL BEDTIME SVC. is too wonderful unbelievable & Allie slept all nite.  See some pix attached.  We can't wait to go again!
ROBERT DAD OF ALLIE

originalText.text: Camp Canine and the entire staff are amazing. I have boarded both of my dogs many times at Camp Canine and always feel at ease knowing my dogs are in the best hands. Mike the owner runs the place top notch. They post pictures of the dogs, provide Central Park walks, cuddle time grooming and anything the dogs need to be happy and safe. Always responsive with any questions or concerns. Only place I would board my dogs!!!

text.text: Camp Canine and the entire staff are amazing. I have boarded both of my dogs many times at Camp Canine and always feel at ease knowing my dogs are in the best hands. originalText.text: Camp Canine is beyond precious to me and my pup who goes there for daycare.  The time and the effort taken to make a fun experience for the dogs (and those of us who live vicariously through them) is unmatched.  So many special touches and fun little “pawties” and activities for them, it’s really a great community of pet owners to be a part of and I’m forever grateful we found Camp Canine!
